author: dcspark
title: Smart contract upgradability
description: Actuellement, les contrats intelligents de Cardano n'ont pas de modèle de conception standard pour la mise à niveau, ce qui est problématique pour les DAO ou les dApps en cours de test.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the main objectives of the challenge, by proposing a standard for upgradability of Cardano smart contracts.  Currently smart contracts in Cardano have no standard design pattern for upgradability which is problematic for DAOs or dApps in-testing. The problem is not exclusive in Cardano, even Ethereum does not have standard for smart contract upgradability. In my opinion the team's idea has excellent potential to improve Cardano ecosystem and be a great help for developer community. As a smart contract developer, I also encounter the upgradability problem. The standard for smart contract upgradability means DAOs and DApps could have more flexibility for improving their system.
f6_assessments.q1: As ex-Emurgo and ex-IOHK employees, team members have relevant experience and significant network in the Cardano development that could boost the likelihood of project success. However, they did'nt provide details about how to execute the project. The team requested a budget without detail on how the money will be spend or allocated. There is no roadmap, budget breakdown, or timeline for the execution of this project in the proposal. My suggestion for the team is to complete the proposal with more information and details.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no clear success metrics or KPI in the proposal. The team does not provide deliverables, roadmap, or detailed plan on how to execute the project and there is no budget breakdown in the proposal. Team does not mention where they will publish the progress of project execution making it difficult to trace, monitor, or audit the project. My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details including deliverables, goals, KPI, roadmap, detailed execution plan, and budget breakdown.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Create a standard for upgradeability of Cardano smart contracts is a great idea to help programmers access and build projects on Cardano platform easily and conveniently. Besides, it can help the projects to be done systematically. In the long run can update and develop easily. This is a very important idea for the development of Cardano and projects on Cardano. I really like this idea.
But for this proposal, the team has also stated that they will spend time researching and developing the required design patterns to safely implement dApp smart contract upgrading. Therefore, in this proposal, it is only an idea of ​​​​the solution that the team will implement. There is no specific product or plan to implement this proposal at fund 7 yet
I hope to see the product of this proposal soon."
f6_assessments.q1:
"The team is composed of well known ex-Emurgo and ex-IOHK employees who have been building the Cardano ecosystem for the past several years. I am really impressed with this experience of the team. With this experience, I have absolutely no doubt about the possibility of this idea if it is true. But I have yet to see propser offer any evidence for those personal experiences. This reduces confidence in the team's experience.
In addition, the lack of a specific plan is also a big barrier to verify the feasibility of the proposal."
f6_assessments.q2: No plan is presented on what is actually going to be done, or why $15000 is needed to achieve it.  Please come back with a plan for what you will actually implement,

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about creating a standard for the upgradability of Cardano smart contracts. I am convinced by this idea, but not the plan. Conceptually, I think it's a definite fit for the challenge, meets the given requirements, and has potential impact if accomplished. However, based on the information given, I disagree with the impact of this recommendation and would give it a 2.
f6_assessments.q1: This team is described as "composed of well-known ex-Emurgo and ex-IOHK employees", but without further information or external link for verification. Besides, there is no roadmap or KPIs, no budget distribution,...]. From my point of view, it is hard to assess a proposal with very limited information. Therefore, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: For better auditability, the following information should be provided: (1) Team description with evidence; (2) roadmap and KPIs; (3) risk management. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0: Upgradability for smart contracts will make it easier for DAOs to manage themselves, and availability on Github from 1Q'22 sounds reasonable enough. The core merit of this proposal, however, is in the value this research will provide for the confidence in Cardano for DeFi. Therefore, I wholeheartedly support it.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the team of proposers is beyond doubt given their track record. The proposal is light on details about the implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal lacks any KPI or roadmap except the planned date of completion, which is disappointing given the importance and good intentions of the proposal. There are no attachments, no weblinks and only 1 comment. Without the high degree of credibility that the team of proposers enjoy, an even lower ranking may have been justified.

solution: Créer une norme pour la mise à niveau des contrats intelligents Cardano.
experience: Notre équipe est composée d'anciens employés d'Emurgo et d'IHK bien connus qui ont construit l'écosystème Cardano au cours des dernières années.
